summary: Alan B. Hausman was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is mentioned in multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. These documents list his name, position, and salary during that period. The consistent appearance of his name across these administrative documents indicates his employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
